result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn E Ormond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Defendant must not have any alcohol in his home. No taverns, bars, or liquor stores or stores that sell alcohol. Do not associate with users or sellers of controlled substances.May not operate a motor vehicle without agent's approval. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must pay child support in compliance with court orders. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Shawn E Ormond in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Shawn E Ormond in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense is asking for bond reduction of a total of $450.00, split as $150.00 bond per case with the remaining amount as a signature bond to allow him to participate into the Salvation Army program as outlined by defense. If the defendant is not accepted into the program, bonds will revert back to cash as originally ordered and the defendant will turn himself into RCJ.
The State prefers that deft attempt the intake process while in custody and if he is accepted, the bonds can be addressed at this time.

BTC: Bonds to be modified to $450.00 cash - $150.00 cash on each file plus $1,000.00 co-signature bond by mother, Sylvia Adams DOB 10/9/1963 and father Ernest Franklin Ormond DOB 12/14/1957. Deft to go to Salvation Army program within 24 hours to begin the process and see if he qualifies. Parents must         report to the Court that the deft was either accepted or rejected or if the deft leaves the program for any reason. If defendant leaves the program for any reason, the bonds will be forfeited. No alcohol. Defendant is to execute a medical release form allowing the program to notify deft's parents as well as the Court of deft's status.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.

ALONG WITH $1000.00 CO-SIGNATURE BOND WITH DEFENDANT'S MOTHER, SYLVIA ADAMS, DOB 10/9/1963 AND FATHER ERNEST FRANKLIN ORMOND DOB 12/14/1957 - BOTH WITH PHOTO ID. Ct 1: 946.49(1)(b)-Felony BJ. No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  Defendant is to go to Salvation Army program within 24 hours to being the intake process and see if he qualifies. Parents must report to the Court that the defendant was either accepted or rejected or if the defendant leaves the program for any reason. The defendant is to sign medical authorizations allowing the program to convey information to Attorney Anderson and to his parents who will then inform the Court. If the defendant leaves the program for any reason, the bonds will be forfeited. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
